snippet: The outcry began when the Postal Service decided to prune trees by its parking lot in Oakland and five baby herons fell from their nests, but some people say the situation has descended into absurdity.
abstract: Tree trimmer Ernesto Pulido may face federal charges for violating the Migratory Bird Treaty Act of 1918 after trimming trees outside Oakland, Calif, post office where protected herons were nesting; United States Postal Service hired Pulido to prune trees because birds were defecating on mail trucks, but in the course of the job, five baby black-crowned night herons fell from their nests and were injured.
lead_paragraph: The outcry began when the Postal Service decided to prune trees by its parking lot in Oakland and five baby herons fell from their nests, but some people say the situation has descended into absurdity.

headline.main: Birds Leave Nest Involuntarily, and Oakland Fumes
headline.print_headline: Birds Leave Nest Involuntarily, and Oakland Fumes
